message_1:
Convert the following proposition into intuitionistic logic using ¬, ∧, and ∨:

"If it is sunny outside and I have an umbrella, then I will take a walk."

The answer should be in the form of a formula.
message_2:
Let S represent "it is sunny outside", U represent "I have an umbrella", and W represent "I will take a walk". The given proposition can be written as:

(S ∧ U) → W

In intuitionistic logic, we can represent the implication using ¬ and ∨. The formula becomes:

¬(S ∧ U) ∨ W
